intro: Glochidion fuscum, commonly known as the dark glochidion, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Glochidion fuscum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
